newsitem.title: FRANCE: INSTANT VIEW - French February unemployment.
newsitem.headline: INSTANT VIEW - French February unemployment.

text.p: Following are analysts' comments on a February fall of 7,500 in French unemployment, reported by the Labour Ministry on Friday, which was accompanied by a rise in the ILO unemployment rate to 12.8 percent from 12.7.
Economists had been predicting a rise in the absolute number. Statistics institute INSEE said this week that it expected the jobless rate to climb to 12.9 percent in June.
We were expecting 12.8 percent. The absolute number is not very interesting. We're still holding to a forecast of 13 percent (ILO rate) by mid-year.

The unemployment figures are fairly surprising. We were not expecting a fall. But since the changes in registering the unemployed in October, the figures have become very volatile. Long-term unemployment is up sharply since the reallocation of resources to youth unemployment.

Overall employment figures have been a little bit better over the last three or four months. But the improvement is not enough to brake the rise in unemployment. We are expecting a continuation in the rise in the unemployment rate to 13.1 percent in the middle of the year followed by a stabilisation.
